tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE water_usage_data (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_name TEXT,
    customer_address TEXT,
    water_meter_id INT,
    water_usage_gallons INT,
    reading_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE customers (
    customer_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    address VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    city VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    state VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE usage_data (
    data_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT NOT NULL,
    usage_date DATE NOT NULL,
    gallons_used INT NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT fk_customer_id
        FOREIGN KEY (customer_id)
        REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Customer (
	customer_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
	customer_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	customer_address VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
	customer_city VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE WaterMeter (
	meter_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
	meter_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
	customer_id UUID REFERENCES Customer(customer_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
)

CREATE TABLE WaterUsage (
	usage_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
	meter_id UUID REFERENCES WaterMeter(meter_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
	usage_date DATE NOT NULL,
	usage_gallons INT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE customers (
  customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  city VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  state VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE water_meters (
  meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT NOT NULL,
  meter_location VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  installation_date DATE NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE water_usage (
  usage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  meter_id INT NOT NULL,
  usage_date DATE NOT NULL,
  gallons_used INT NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES water_meters(meter_id)
);

CREATE TABLE usage_trends (
  trend_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  usage_id INT NOT NULL,
  trend_analysis VARCHAR(1000) NOT NULL,
  trend_date DATE NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (usage_id) REFERENCES water_usage(usage_id)
);
